intro: Schwenkfelda aspera, commonly known as the rough schwenkfelda, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its hairy, rough-textured leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Schwenkfelda aspera is often found in rocky or sandy habitats, thriving in well-drained soils. Its unique appearance and adaptability make it a notable species within its native range.
